0.title: Rules (v. Base)
0.body:
Dungeon Dash - Composite Rules

Focus
Connie - Theme / introductory text
Sam - Board / room building
Alex - Event Deck - card interactions
Will - Cards
Kyle - TTS collaboration & base prototype

Name
TBD

Introductory Flavor Text
After forming a ragged exploration party with local personalities, delve into the depths of the region’s most notorious dungeons while working towards a personalized hidden objective.   Form alliances, turn on fellow explorers, and make false promises to gather survival gear and fulfill your objective.  Take the lead and emerge as the sole survivor of the expedition-- no questions asked.

Components
Motivation Cards
Enemy Cards
Item Cards
Room Cards
(2) Six-Sided Dice
(6) Player Pieces
Board

Objective
Each player’s goal is to accumulate 10 points in their respective motivation by the end of the game.

Players
3-6 players

Setup
Each player selects one (1) player piece to represent their character.
Separate and shuffle the stacks of cards and place them on the board in their aligned positions.
Have each player roll the die.
The highest roll draws one (1) motivation card first, proceeding through all players from highest roll to lowest roll.
If there is a tie, those players will proceed until the tie is broken.
In reverse order of the drawing of motivation cards, have each player draw three (3) item cards.
Have any player draw one (1) room card, which will contain the first room’s mechanics.
Begin the game in a rotation of turns, starting with the player who rolled the highest number.

Play
Each round begins with the reading of the room card.  A room card will describe how many (if any) monsters are present in the room, how many items are present, and the possible exits (4 cardinal directions).  The appropriate number of monster cards are drawn and revealed to all players.  These threats must be dealt with before the next room may be entered.

The first player will begin their turn with the option to play any item cards that they may be holding.  When they are ready (and if an enemy is present), their combat begins by rolling the die.  If they roll a one (1), they immediately end their turn.  If they roll between a 2-6, they prepare to deal damage to the monster.  After their roll, and before the damage is applied, one item card may be played by any other player in order to alter the combat events-- players may come to their aid, or sabotage them mid-combat.  If the player has successfully dealt damage to the monster after another card has been played, they may roll the dice again for loot.  If their loot roll is a one (1), or greater than the amount of damage they dealt, they earn no loot.  Otherwise, they loot an item card.  They end their turn.

Player turns continue within a round until the monster(s) are defeated.  Players may only loot items as long as the room card has dictated that there are items available to be looted.  When all monsters are eliminated in a room, the next player chooses an exit, and the next round begins.

Play ends when 10 rooms have been cleared.
Resolution
After the ten rooms have been progressed through, each player will reveal their motivations and respective motivation points.

Details and Reference
FAQ and things that need clarification.

Credits
Game Design: Will Hongach III, Samuel Beckmann, Kyle James, Connie McGinnis, Alex Lawrence
Original Game Idea: Nick Bryan

ObjectStates.Name: Checker_black
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onload()
  self.createButton({ click_function = 'toggleZone',
                      label = 'Lower Zones',
                      function_owner = self,
                      position = {0, 0.3, 0},
                      rotation = {0, 0, 0},
                      width = 1400,
                      height = 500,
                      font_size = 200})
end

offset = -10
function toggleZone()
    local allObjects = getAllObjects()
    for _,o in ipairs(allObjects) do        if o.name == "FogOfWarTrigger" then
            if o.isSmoothMoving() then return end            o.translate({0,offset,0})        end
    end
    offset = offset * -1
end
